definition: (dialect) no good/(contraction of 不 and 好)/see 孬種|孬种[nao1 zhong3]

sentences.english: There are black sheep in nearly every large family;
sentences.chinese: 幾乎在每個大家庭裏都有孬種。

sentences.english: When you say that when someone coward In fact, I already know you have been a guilty conscience.
sentences.chinese: 當你說別人孬種的時候我已經知道其實你一直在心虛。

sentences.english: Would you like to know which of them were cowards?
sentences.chinese: 你想知道他們裏面誰是最孬種的嗎？

sentences.english: Would you like to know which of them were cowards ?
sentences.chinese: 你想知道他們之中誰是孬種嗎？

definition: to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
